title: Thịt Kho Trứng (Pork & Egg Caramelized)
description: A classic Vietnamese braised pork and eggs dish with tender caramelized pork belly simmered in a fragrant sweet-salty sauce. Rich, savory, and slightly sweet with hard-boiled eggs that soak up flavorful braising liquid—served best with steamed rice and pickled vegetables.

ingredients.display_name: pork belly, skin removed and cut into 1-inch cubes

ingredients.notes: can substitute low-sodium chicken stock + 1 tbsp light sugar

ingredients.display_name: palm sugar or light brown sugar

ingredients.notes: to adjust braising liquid if needed

steps.text: Prep the eggs by placing them in a pot, covering with cold water, bringing to a boil, then simmering 9 minutes; transfer to ice bath, peel, and set aside.
Cut pork belly into uniform 1-inch cubes and pat dry; season lightly with a pinch of pepper.
Make caramel in a wide heavy-bottomed pot: heat oil over medium, add sugar and let it melt and darken to an amber color, watching carefully to avoid burning.
Immediately add sliced shallots and minced garlic to the caramel and stir briefly to coat and soften for aromatic base.
Add pork cubes to the pot, increase heat to medium-high, and sear for 6–8 minutes, stirring occasionally so pieces pick up caramel color on all sides.
Deglaze with fish sauce and soy sauce, stirring to dissolve browned bits; pour in coconut water and a small amount of water if liquid level is low. Bring to a gentle boil.
Lower heat to maintain a gentle simmer, cover partially, and braise the pork for 50 minutes until tender, stirring and skimming foam occasionally.
Add the peeled hard-boiled eggs to the braise, spoon sauce over them, and continue simmering uncovered for 10 minutes so eggs absorb color and flavor.
Uncover and increase heat slightly to reduce sauce until glossy and slightly thickened, about 12 minutes; adjust seasoning with additional fish sauce or sugar to taste.
Finish with freshly ground black pepper and scatter sliced scallions over the top. Let rest 5 minutes before serving with steamed rice and pickles.
